subject: History
title: The Lusitania and America's Entry
description: Learn The Lusitania and America's Entry in one minute.

hook.text: A German submarine sank a passenger liner in 18 minutes, killing 1,198 peopleâ€”128 of them Americans. It changed the war.

buildup.text: RMS Lusitania sailed from New York in May 1915. Germany had warned that ships entering the war zone were targets.

discovery.text: A U-boat torpedo struck the ship off Ireland. A second mysterious explosion followed. The ship sank in 18 minutes.

twist.text: The second explosion may have been munitions secretly carried in the cargo hold. The Lusitania was not purely civilian.

climax.text: Outrage over the sinking turned American opinion against Germany. Two years later, the US entered the war.

punchline.text: One torpedo sank a ship and tilted a world war.

quiz.question: How did the sinking of the Lusitania affect World War I?
options: It caused Britain to immediately increase submarine production
It turned American opinion against Germany and contributed to US entry in 1917
It led to an immediate ceasefire on the Western Front
